SENT.plain: Secondary paroxysmal dyskinesias (PxD) have been previously reported in patients with multiple sclerosis, lacunar infarcts, head trauma, metabolic disorders such as hyperglycaemia, hypocalcaemia, migraine and central nervous system (CNS) infections
The causative lesions typically involve the basal ganglia structures, medulla and rarely the spinal cord
We report two patients who presented with paroxysmal dyskinesias as the only manifestation of subcortical white-matter ischaemia
Patient 1 presented with 3-year history of paroxysmal kinesigenic dyskinesia (PKD) and patient 2 with 6-month history of paroxysmal nonkinesigenic dyskinesia (PNKD)
All investigations, including CSF oligoclonal bands were negative, except for a brain MRI which showed multiple, non-enhancing subcortical white matter lacunar infarcts
Therefore, subcortical white matter ischaemia should also be included in the differential diagnosis of PxD
